page.title: 13FARMING. HEALTH.
page.content: Mainly dairy and beef cattle and sheep with some arable farming for cattle food. Corn is grown as a cash crop for straw, and to ensure rotation of the land. Other crops include hay, silage and turnips.A sprinkling of pigs and poultry mainly for domestic use - not intensively farmed. Most of the farms are mechanically equipped for normal usage,the larger seasonal items (bal- er,combines etc), being hired as nece- ssary from contractors. All farms have barns and covered stores for hay,straw feed,machinery and cattle varying from traditional store barns to large modern pre-fabricated structures. There is a trout farm at Catsbridge. Health-good. All this clean air and healthy living. Doctors,hospitals, health visitors,districts nurses etc - outside area. (Illnesses covered by Tavistock and Plymouth services).
